title: Relational communication / statement frame
description: Relational / statement-level frame for attributed communications such as reports, statements, and quotations (e.g. "According to X, Y", "X said that â€¦").

frame_type.description: Stable discriminator for this relational family. When provided, it SHOULD be "rel.communication-statement".

id.description: Optional stable identifier for this communication fact (for cross-references, provenance, etc.).

source.description: Speaker / author / authority providing the statement (e.g. a person, organization, or group). May be given as an identifier, name string, or small inline entity object.

oneOf.description: Identifier or label for the source entity.
Inline entity-like object for the source.

id.description: Canonical identifier for the source entity.

name.description: Human-readable name for the source entity.

kind.description: Optional coarse type label for the source (e.g. "person", "organization", "publication").

content.description: Propositional content that is being attributed to the source. Typically another frame encoded as JSON, or a small structured object; may also be a simple scalar or list.

audience.description: Intended audience or target of the communication, if relevant (e.g. "parliament", "public"). Same encoding conventions as `source`.

oneOf.description: Identifier or label for the audience entity.
Inline entity-like object for the audience.

id.description: Canonical identifier for the audience entity.

name.description: Human-readable name for the audience entity.

kind.description: Optional coarse type label for the audience (e.g. "institution", "public").

time.description: When the communication took place, as a coarse date or time span.

start_year.description: Start year of the time span.

end_year.description: End year of the time span (inclusive or exclusive depending on project convention).

point_in_time.description: Single date or timestamp (e.g. ISO 8601 string).

text.description: Human-readable description of the time span (e.g. "late 19th century").

quoted_text.description: Optional direct-quote surface if the wording should be preserved (e.g. for quotation-style realizations).

certainty.description: Confidence that the attribution (that the source said the content) is correct. 0.0 = completely uncertain, 1.0 = maximal confidence.

source_id.description: Optional provenance handle for the fact that "source communicated content" (e.g. citation key, statement ID).

extra.description: Open-ended metadata map for caller-specific fields that are not interpreted generically by the NLG pipeline.
